meanings.definition: to place something on a base or foundation
meanings.sent1: She surbased the vase on the table.
meanings.sent2: The builder surbased the house on solid ground.
meanings.sent3: The cat surbased itself on the cozy pillow.
meanings.sent4: His argument was surbased on false information.
meanings.sent5: The tree's roots surbased deep into the earth.

meanings.sent1: The surbased structure stood strong against the wind.
meanings.sent2: The surbased platform provided stability for the tent.
meanings.sent3: The surbased cake was delicious and well-balanced.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence was surbased on years of hard work.
meanings.sent5: The surbased building withstood the earthquake.

meanings.definition: to support or prop up with a base or foundation
meanings.sent1: He surbased the shelf with additional brackets.
meanings.sent2: The columns surbased the weight of the roof.
meanings.sent3: The idea was surbased by strong evidence.
meanings.sent4: The friendship was surbased on mutual respect.
meanings.sent5: The team surbased their strategy on teamwork.
